TopicTitle: Modding Mondays Bonus Round: Dang It!

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n7ana5qU8K1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81794"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/6e6ad64e17104bccf882b67b85fad857/tumblr_inline_n7angu4FdI1rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p>Some mods are too much fun to exclude from a <strong>Modding Monday</strong> and this is one of them. <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81794"><strong>DANG IT!</strong></a> A Random Failures Mod for <em>KSP</em> was created by Ippo and does exactly as advertised - it causes parts on your ship to fail at random. Now, you might be thinking that you experience all types of<em> KSP</em> failures on the regular. No sweat, right? Well, with this mod, you have to repair your failed parts before youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re able to use them again. Some repairs may be simple, while others - others will be teeth-grinding.</p>

<p>There are many other wonderful details to Dang It, including interplay with other parts using Module Manager and even the act of how the parts themselves, age.</p>

<p>Find out more about <strong>Dang It!</strong> by going <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81794"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

<p><strong>Small warning: this mod is still in development, so be indulgent </strong></p>
Awesome, knew this would get on here eventually
The only reason I haven't installed it is because it requires the latest version of Module Manager, which unfortunately most of my other mods haven't updated to yet. Maybe when 0.24 hits ...

The only reason I haven't installed it is because it requires the latest version of Module Manager, which unfortunately most of my other mods haven't updated to yet. Maybe when 0.24 hits ...

Module Manager has backwards compatibility for pretty much everything, so unless your mods use pre 1.5 module manager, it should be fine

Module Manager has backwards compatibility for pretty much everything, so unless your mods use pre 1.5 module manager, it should be fine

I've tried it with the new MM. My game always has some white text in the loading screen that's blurred together so I can't read them, but fear that they are error messages usually forces me to exit the game and switch it out.
Neat mod, but I never want to use it. Especailly when on my grand tour an engine malfuntiones on a tylo lander or something

I've tried it with the new MM. My game always has some white text in the loading screen that's blurred together so I can't read them, but fear that they are error messages usually forces me to exit the game and switch it out.

This is usually a conflict between several versions of MM being present in your GameData folder, you only need 1 copy of it, otherwise it cconflicts with itself. A lot of mods have MM bundled with them, so check your subdirectories for older/other copies of it and remove them, just keep one. This should clear your problem.

I would like to thank everyone for this, it really blew my mind when I saw it. It changes the way I need to think about this mod now that I know there is at least some interest in it... It's not my own pet project anymore

However, I feel I need to address a couple of points, mainly:

1) BEWARE: it's still way, way unfinished. New bugs are coming by the dozens every day: try at your own risk. I'm working on it as much as I can, promise

2) I think it's only proper to share credit with IRnifty: he's working on a very similar project called Kerbal Mechanics, and we have been in touch exchanging tips and ideas. If my mod is finished enough to be featured, then his is too (possibly more)

Thank you everyone, I'll try my best

I'll see you in the dev thread where you can post your ideas and suggestions!

Got any bug report? Of course you do: let me know in the release thread!
Wow! Congrats, Ippo on being featured! And thanks so much for sharing credit. I see a bright future ahead for our mods!

I've tried it with the new MM. My game always has some white text in the loading screen that's blurred together so I can't read them, but fear that they are error messages usually forces me to exit the game and switch it out.

It is just apllying patches. Nothing to worry 'bout
I reckon this should be in the actual game. It actually means there's a purpose of having kerbals on your craft!

I reckon this should be in the actual game. It actually means there's a purpose of having kerbals on your craft!
